{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3591711,"name":"rsegrest","username":"rsegrest","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rsegrest/{size}/3240_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:15:43.651Z","cooked":"

Hello CD Experts,

Our team is looking into purchasing a laser cutter for next season. I have searched CD and the most recent posts I have found are dated pre-2020. We are looking for:

  • 120+ Watt
  • 4’ x 4’ bed
  • <$7k (<$5k would be amazing but probably not reasonable lol)

Does anyone have a laser cutter that they absolutely love and could not live without?

TIA

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:15:43.651Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":199,"reads":636,"readers_count":635,"score":1147.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"rsegrest","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9415,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3591713,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:18:19.918Z","cooked":"
rsegrest:

120+ Watt

IMO a 60W machine can do anything you need for FRC. I’d pay more attention to the overall quality of the machine than the wattage.

A relevant adage here: “What is cheap, is expensive.”

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:18:58.976Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":609,"readers_count":608,"score":206.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/2","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591718,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:23:40.204Z","cooked":"

There are several out there…

Swyft has one…it is not the size you you want…

SWYFT Robotics

100W 35" x 24" CO2 Laser Cutter (Recommended for FRC Teams)

CO2 Laser Cutter: The Ultimate Build Season Advantage Tired of outsourcing parts and waiting for deliveries? Take control of your build season with a CO2 Laser Cutter. This machine empowers your team to:   Rapid Prototyping: Quickly iterate on...

Price: USD 3,499.99

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:23:40.204Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":578,"readers_count":577,"score":130.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://swyftrobotics.com/products/100w-35-x-24-co2-laser-cutter-recommended-for-frc-teams","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"100W 35" x 24" CO2 Laser Cutter (Recommended for FRC Teams) – SWYFT Robotics","clicks":96}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/3","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591733,"name":"rsegrest","username":"rsegrest","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rsegrest/{size}/3240_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:28:30.406Z","cooked":"

Yes, cheap often breaks or is hard to use, I completely agree on that. I just have to stay within budget guidelines for my school district. Anything over $5k requires 3 bids etc. The wattage was recommended by a local engineer.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:28:30.406Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":557,"readers_count":556,"score":131.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"rsegrest","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9415,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591739,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:30:10.623Z","cooked":"
rsegrest:

The wattage was recommended by a local engineer.

Ask him what his opinion on a 60W laser would be, given a workflow mostly involving plywood and delrin (these are, I think, consensus best-materials for FRC laser cutting). I think you might get a better quality machine at your price point at that power level.

I could be wrong, though!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:30:10.623Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":542,"readers_count":541,"score":113.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/5","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"open_mouth","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591744,"name":"rsegrest","username":"rsegrest","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rsegrest/{size}/3240_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:35:17.163Z","cooked":"

TBH, I’m not sure why they recommended the 100w+

The main materials we want to use it for are:

Plywood - up to 1" thickness
Polycarb - both 1/8" and 1/4" thickness
Aluminum - engraving

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:35:17.163Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":518,"readers_count":517,"score":113.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"rsegrest","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9415,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591747,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:36:57.979Z","cooked":"
rsegrest:

Polycarb - both 1/8" and 1/4" thickness

Warning you ahead of time to expect the results here to be acceptable at best, and sloppy/awful at worst. Also, be really sure you have your ventilation set up if you’re gonna cut polycarb; the fumes are particularly nasty/corrosive. 1/4’’ is going to be particularly troublesome.

Delrin is a really good choice because it’s really hard to screw up a cut - it tends to vaporize cleanly at the cut interface instead of melting.

Acrylic cuts the nicest of all the plastics, but is too brittle to be useful except for aesthetics.

Always favor low power and multiple passes!

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:39:40.639Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":509,"readers_count":508,"score":196.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/7","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591764,"name":"rsegrest","username":"rsegrest","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rsegrest/{size}/3240_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:56:08.086Z","cooked":"

You have no idea how much I appreciate the advice! I’m not the engineering mastermind, just the IT teacher who has learned more about engineering than I ever dreamed and all of it from getting involved with FRC 18 years ago.

Anything else you might recommend that we watch out for? We want to use the laser cutter for quick prototyping with plywood and bumper frames. For our builds, the polycarb is used mainly for protecting components and very occasionally for various structural pieces - for instance, this year we manufactured our coral intake using both 1/8 and 1/4 polycarb, last year our under the bumper and over the frame intake had polycarb side plates. My thought was that the laser cutter might be a better option than our for those cuts and it would free up the CNC for aluminum.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T13:56:08.086Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":481,"readers_count":480,"score":136.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"rsegrest","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9415,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591767,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T13:58:17.061Z","cooked":"
rsegrest:

Anything else you might recommend that we watch out for?

Be prepared to service the thing and replace the lenses/mirrors on a scheduled basis.

Really lean into the fact that part turnover on a laser is lightning fast, and use it to iterate rapidly. You don’t need to waste time on a mill/router until you know the dimensions once you have a laser - so, don’t.

Lasers are a really good “first CNC machine” experience for students, because there’s no work holding and it’s relatively hard to make the machine damage itself. Make use of that in your training sequence.

Let your students have fun making art on the laser when it’s not in use for other things. Engraving is cool, and is a good low-stakes way to practice fine-tuning the machine settings.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T14:00:51.859Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":464,"readers_count":463,"score":227.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/9","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591774,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T14:03:27.633Z","cooked":"

There are several laser options out there. I have owned 2. A CO2 and a 30W fiber. I hadn’t had any luck with engraving Aluminum. Marking it with spray…much better.

Word of advice: IF you stay close to 100% on the laser…the shorter the lifespan of the laser tube. Usually cut in about half. Now…this is IF you spend a lot of time at 100%.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T14:03:27.633Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":445,"readers_count":444,"score":124.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/10","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591776,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T14:04:40.890Z","cooked":"
RicDV:

Now…this is IF you spend a lot of time at 100%.

Addendum: don’t. As I mentioned above, the best strategy for both cut quality and tool longevity is to run at lower duty cycles for multiple passes. This takes longer, but the laser is already such a fast machine that the difference doesn’t matter much.

Shoutout to the University of Maryland for teaching me these best practices as a research intern

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T14:05:24.372Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":440,"readers_count":439,"score":163.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/11","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591779,"name":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","username":"RicDV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ricdv/{size}/188502_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T14:09:41.687Z","cooked":"

Another laser I have been looking at…I just don’t have the room. It has been a minute since I had priced it out. Located in San Antonio…training is included. Many lasers don’t provide inperson training.

SA Laser - Laser Engraving Machines & Training

Razor 3 Duo - Industrial CO2 Laser System

The Razor Duo stands as a groundbreaking advancement in laser technology, uniquely equipped with a dual-source laser system that combines a powerful 130W CO2 glass tube and a precise 50W RF laser source. This innovative combination allows for an...

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T14:09:41.687Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":431,"readers_count":430,"score":106.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://salasers.com/product/razor-3-duo-industrial-co2-laser/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Razor 3 Duo - Industrial CO2 Laser System - SA Laser - Laser Engraving Machines & Training","clicks":52}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48664,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor 5503"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/12","custom_user_title":"Mentor 5503","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3591861,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T14:48:07.042Z","cooked":"

449 has had good success with this one:

OMTech Laser

OMTech Maker AF2028-60 60W CO2 Laser Engraver and Cutter with 20" x 28"...

OMTech Maker AF2028-60 60W CO2 laser machine has a 20" x 28" working area, 60w power, and auto-focus for precise results, ideal for cutting and engraving.

rsegrest:

Anything else you might recommend that we watch out for?

Anyone buying a laser now, IMO, should plan around SRPP becoming a major part of their workflow for production robot parts.

REV Robotics

MAXComposite Sheets

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 150

WestCoast Products

SRPP Sheets

SRPP (Self-Reinforced Polypropylene), Compared to polycarbonate, our SRPP is stiffer and significantly more impact resistant, making it useful for systems like intakes, bumpers, or other areas exposed to frequent contact. It’s also lighter than...

Price: USD 149.99

This stuff is seriously good for FRC.

REV has some machining guidelines on it here: MAXComposite | ION BUILD SYSTEM.

This might be worth springing for the 100W.

I made a post last year about our experience with a 100W Omtech laser - we’ve been using it all season and for awhile it became our prototype bottleneck (because our students loved using it so much).

Desktop CO2 Laser Cutter General Forum
Team 461 recently received a grant from Subaru Indiana Automotive (SIA) to purchase an Omtech MF2028-100 laser cutter. While I’ve been meaning to write a detailed review of the purchasing process, delivery experience, and initial impressions, I haven’t managed to pull it all together yet. In short, we’re very pleased with our purchase so far—it has met and exceeded our preseason expectations. Key Requirements for the Laser Cutter We defined a specific scope for our laser cutter to ensure it met…

We were going to try and get some SRPP this season but much to the dismay of everyone on the team we had already tapped out our WC Open PO. I’m going to have to seriously adjust a couple of our numbers to shift more money to WCP next year.

1000% this. SRPP is going to be a staple of our bots going forward.

We have access to a 155W Boss LS-3655 at my work that cuts SRPP no issue. We recently swapped to a 2.5" lens setup on this machine and the REV cut settings are bang on the money.

This is a fairly large machine, but can hold the stock 23"x47" sheets. Fully kitted was around $18k in 2024 dollars. Would highly recommend.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T15:39:55.323Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":365,"readers_count":364,"score":113.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"Harrison Drake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://shop.bosslaser.com/products/ls-3655-co2-laser-cutter-and-engraver","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"LS-3655 CO2 Laser Cutter and Engraver - Boss Laser – BossLaser","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12760,"username":"Knufire","name":"Rahul Yarlagadda","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/knufire/{size}/67820_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead Technical Mentor, WSRP"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/17","custom_user_title":"Lead Technical Mentor, WSRP","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3592496,"name":"AllenGregoryIV","username":"AllenGregoryIV","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/allengregoryiv/{size}/65531_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-14T23:08:45.324Z","cooked":"

We own a 100w 2*3 ThunderLaser and still recommend them.

If we were buying again we’d buy as much wattage and area as we could afford and fit. 150W 3*4 most likely. The extra wattage lets you do thicker materials and cuts faster, the larger space lets you do full size belly pans, robot covers, larger sponsor panels, etc.

OMtech seems to be on the cheaper side and has pretty good reviews.

xTool is also coming out with some interesting options even for metal cutting but I still need a lot more details on their new machine before recommending it. It’s also 2x to 1.5x the cost of a normal CO2 laser.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":32,"updated_at":"2025-04-14T23:08:45.324Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":339,"readers_count":338,"score":172.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":499251,"topic_slug":"laser-cutter-suggestions","display_username":"AllenGregoryIV","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":10647,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515"},"post_url":"/t/laser-cutter-suggestions/499251/18","custom_user_title":"Engineering Coach - Spectrum 3847/Photon 8515","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3592880,"name":"Jackie Gerstein","username":"jgerstein","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jgerstein/{size}/121641_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-15T05:04:30.171Z","cooked":"
rsegrest:

Does anyone have a laser cutter that they absolutely love and could not live without?

I’ve got an Aeon Mira 9 and a 30W fiber galvo laser. I love both machines, but the Mira 9 is well out of your budget and the galvo isn’t going to do what you need.

rsegrest:

We are looking for:

  • 120+ Watt
  • 4’ x 4’ bed
  • <$7k (<$5k would be amazing but probably not reasonable lol)

I’m not aware of anything that meets all these requirements. Which of your criteria are non-negotiable, and what can you be flexible on?

Also, have you budgeted for ventilation? If you aren’t able to vent the laser outside, you’ll need to budget for a fume extractor and regular filter replacements, which will eat into your budget pretty significantly.

rsegrest:

The main materials we want to use it for are:

Plywood - up to 1" thickness
Polycarb - both 1/8" and 1/4" thickness
Aluminum - engraving

I love laser cutters, but between the size and the materials, this is really starting to sound more like a CNC router than a laser cutter to me.

  • Plywood: Plywood in general cuts very well on a laser, but 1" is really going to be pushing it. You can make it work on a high-power CO2 laser with a long focal-length lens, but you’ll need to be patient. Above 3/4" or so, I’d be really considering whether a CNC router is a better choice.
  • Polycarbonate: Absolutely awful on a laser. You can cut it, but as Oblarg already mentioned, you’ll get nasty fumes and a low-quality cut. It’s slow, too. Much better suited to a CNC router.
  • Aluminum: You can use cermark or similar marking solutions to mark aluminum with a CO2 laser. You won’t be able to engrave.
rsegrest:

We want to use the laser cutter for quick prototyping with plywood and bumper frames. … My thought was that the laser cutter might be a better option than our for those cuts and it would free up the CNC for aluminum.

Perfect - this is a great way to use a laser. I used to do similar with my team, and it’s a great way to make use of both the laser cutter and the CNC router. We did a lot of early prototypes in cardboard and plywood, which saved both the more expensive materials and time on the CNC router for more thoroughly developed parts. Prototyping on the laser was fast enough that my students could iterate through several versions of a part in a 3 hour meeting.

With that said, it might be worth considering whether you really need a 4’x4’ 120W laser for prototyping. My team was using a 24"x18" 60W (RF tube) laser, and it was rarely a major limiting factor in what we were doing.

Most lasers in your price range are going to be glass tube lasers, which require water cooling. Make sure you budget for a chiller if it doesn’t come with your machine. RF tube lasers will be more expensive, but the tube lasts longer before needing to be replaced, they don’t need water cooling, and they cut similarly to a glass tube laser almost twice the wattage.

Some suggestions:

  • Thunder Laser is a good balance of price and quality, and have solid support & quality control. I’ve used their Nova and Bolt lines. I really like the Bolt for the RF tube.
  • Omtech is going to give you the most laser for your money, but at the expense of potential frustration and quality control issues. Their 2028 (20cm x 28cm) machines are very common in makerspaces. They’re also the closest I can think of to meeting all your specifications with their 4063 150W machine. If you go down to a 2028 100W, you can get under your $5k preferred budget.
  • I’m more familiar with Hao-Tian for their fiber galvo lasers, but they have some affordable CO2 lasers that might be worth a look.

We’ve been quite happy with our Omtech 100w laser cutting 1/4”” SSRP and plywood. Just be sure to align it when you uncrate it and run a test to determine the optimum height.

Never felt like we needed more power.
